author: financialexpress.com
title: EPFO settles 11 lakh claims in June
text:
Retirement fund body EPFO settled 11.06 lakh claims like PF withdrawals in June, with 38 per cent being settled within three days.
“EPFO has settled 11.06 lakh claims in the month (June). 38 per cent of these were settled within 3 days and 76 per cent within 10 days,” EPFO said in a statement.
The cumulative figure regarding claim settlement for the current fiscal (from April-June 2015) stood at 33.35 lakh claims out of which 43 per cent were settled within 3 days. As many as 79 per cent of the claims were settled within 10 days.
The Employees’ Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has been mandated to settle all claims with 20 days.
June saw the EPFO taking a landmark decision to unveil ‘Nidhi Aapke Nikat’ or ‘PF Near You’, a public outreach initiative aimed at increasing the interaction between the various stakeholders of EPFO.
The ‘PF Near You’ would replace Bhavishyanidhi Adalat and would be held on 10th of every month starting from July, 2015.
The inaugural function for this initiative is scheduled tomorrow at EPFO’s regional office at Dwarka in Delhi, which would be presided over by Labour Minister Bandaru Dattatreya.
According to the statement, the grievance redressal machinery in EPFO was able to dispose more than 18,300 grievances during the month.
A total of 47,914 numbers of grievances were settled from April to June 2015. Only 3,200 grievances were pending for disposal in all the offices of EPFO put together.
“The success of introduction of e-initiatives in EPFO has been evidenced by the fact that 58 lakh EPF members have already activated their UAN (universal account number,” it said.
Besides, more than 42,500 cases registered with Inoperative Account Online Helpdesk have been disposed and more than 53,000 establishments have availed the facility for getting themselves registered with EPFO using the online mode.
Moreover, 1,600 exempted establishments (private PF trusts) have filed online monthly returns using the electronic facility made available to them, it added.
